zeppelin.python.name: zeppelin.python
zeppelin.python.description: Python binary executable path. It is set to python by default.(assume python is in your $PATH)

zeppelin.python.maxResult.name: zeppelin.python.maxResult
zeppelin.python.maxResult.description: Max number of dataframe rows to display.

zeppelin.python.useIPython.name: zeppelin.python.useIPython
zeppelin.python.useIPython.description: Whether use IPython when it is available in `%python`

universe.authType.name: universe.authType
universe.authType.description: Type of authentication for API of Universe. Available values: secEnterprise, secLDAP, secWinAD, secSAPR3

universe.queryTimeout.name: universe.queryTimeout
universe.queryTimeout.description: Query timeout for API of Universe

universe.interpolation.name: universe.interpolation
universe.interpolation.description: Enable ZeppelinContext variable interpolation into paragraph text

zeppelin.kotlin.maxResult.name: zeppelin.kotlin.maxResult
zeppelin.kotlin.maxResult.description: Max number of dataframe rows to display.

zeppelin.kotlin.shortenTypes.name: zeppelin.kotlin.shortenTypes
zeppelin.kotlin.shortenTypes.description: Show short types instead of full, e.g. List<String> or kotlin.collections.List<kotlin.String>

influxdb.logLevel.name: influxdb.logLevel
influxdb.logLevel.description: InfluxDB http client library verbosity level (NONE, BASIC, HEADERS, BODY)

HADOOP_CONF_DIR.name: HADOOP_CONF_DIR
HADOOP_CONF_DIR.description: Location of hadoop conf (core-site.xml, hdfs-site.xml and etc.)

flink.execution.mode.name: flink.execution.mode
flink.execution.mode.description: Execution mode, it could be local|remote|yarn

flink.execution.remote.host.name: flink.execution.remote.host
flink.execution.remote.host.description: Host name of running JobManager. Only used for remote mode

flink.execution.remote.port.name: flink.execution.remote.port
flink.execution.remote.port.description: Port of running JobManager. Only used for remote mode

local.number-taskmanager.name: local.number-taskmanager
local.number-taskmanager.description: Number of TaskManager in local mode

flink.webui.yarn.useProxy.name: flink.webui.yarn.useProxy
flink.webui.yarn.useProxy.description: Whether use yarn proxy url as flink weburl, e.g. http://localhost:8088/proxy/application_1583396598068_0004

flink.webui.yarn.address.name: flink.webui.yarn.address
flink.webui.yarn.address.description: Set this value only when your yarn address is mapped to some other address, e.g. some cloud vender will map `http://resource-manager:8088` to `https://xxx-yarn.yy.cn/gateway/kkk/yarn`

flink.udf.jars.name: flink.udf.jars
flink.udf.jars.description: Flink udf jars (comma separated), Zeppelin will register udfs in this jar for user automatically, these udf jars could be either local files or hdfs files if you have hadoop installed, the udf name is the class name

flink.udf.jars.packages.name: flink.udf.jars.packages
flink.udf.jars.packages.description: Packages (comma separated) that would be searched for the udf defined in `flink.udf.jars`

flink.execution.jars.name: flink.execution.jars
flink.execution.jars.description: Additional user jars (comma separated), these jars could be either local files or hdfs files if you have hadoop installed

flink.execution.packages.name: flink.execution.packages
flink.execution.packages.description: Additional user packages (comma separated), e.g. flink connector packages

zeppelin.flink.scala.color.name: zeppelin.flink.scala.color
zeppelin.flink.scala.color.description: Whether display scala shell output in colorful format

zeppelin.flink.hive.version.name: zeppelin.flink.hive.version
zeppelin.flink.hive.version.description: Hive version that you would like to connect

zeppelin.flink.module.enableHive.name: zeppelin.flink.module.enableHive
zeppelin.flink.module.enableHive.description: Whether enable hive module, hive udf take precedence over flink udf if hive module is enabled.

zeppelin.flink.maxResult.name: zeppelin.flink.maxResult
zeppelin.flink.maxResult.description: Max number of rows returned by sql interpreter.

flink.interpreter.close.shutdown_cluster.name: flink.interpreter.close.shutdown_cluster
flink.interpreter.close.shutdown_cluster.description: Whether shutdown flink cluster when close interpreter

zeppelin.interpreter.close.cancel_job.name: zeppelin.interpreter.close.cancel_job
zeppelin.interpreter.close.cancel_job.description: Whether cancel flink job when closing interpreter

zeppelin.flink.job.check_interval.name: zeppelin.flink.job.check_interval
zeppelin.flink.job.check_interval.description: Check interval (in milliseconds) to check flink job progress

zeppelin.flink.concurrentBatchSql.max.name: zeppelin.flink.concurrentBatchSql.max
zeppelin.flink.concurrentBatchSql.max.description: Max concurrent sql of Batch Sql

zeppelin.flink.concurrentStreamSql.max.name: zeppelin.flink.concurrentStreamSql.max
zeppelin.flink.concurrentStreamSql.max.description: Max concurrent sql of Stream Sql

neo4j.database.name: neo4j.database
neo4j.database.description: The Neo4j target database, if empty use the dafault db.

neo4j.multi.statement.name: neo4j.multi.statement
neo4j.multi.statement.description: Enables the multi statement management, if true it computes multiple queries separated by semicolon.

neo4j.max.concurrency.name: neo4j.max.concurrency
neo4j.max.concurrency.description: Max concurrency call from Zeppelin to Neo4j server.

zeppelin.interpreter.rpc.portRange.name: zeppelin.interpreter.rpc.portRange
zeppelin.interpreter.rpc.portRange.description: The process port of the submarine interpreter container mapping defined in the `scripts/docker/interpreter/submarine/tensorflow_gpu/Dockerfile` file

submarine.hadoop.krb5.conf.name: submarine.hadoop.krb5.conf
submarine.hadoop.krb5.conf.description: submarine user-defined hdfs/yarn kerberos authentication krb5.conf

docker.container.network.name: docker.container.network
docker.container.network.description: Network name in the docker container

submarine.algorithm.hdfs.path.name: submarine.algorithm.hdfs.path
submarine.algorithm.hdfs.path.description: Algorithm file upload HDFS path, Support ${username} variable symbol, For example: hdfs:///usr/${username}

zeppelin.python.name: zeppelin.python
zeppelin.python.description: Python directory. It is set to python by default.(assume python is in your $PATH)

zeppelin.python.maxResult.name: zeppelin.python.maxResult
zeppelin.python.maxResult.description: Max number of dataframe rows to display.

zeppelin.python.useIPython.name: zeppelin.python.useIPython
zeppelin.python.useIPython.description: whether use IPython when it is available

shell.command.timeout.millisecs.name: shell.command.timeout.millisecs
shell.command.timeout.millisecs.description: Shell command time out in millisecs. Default = 60000

spark.master.name: spark.master
spark.master.description: Spark master uri. local | yarn-client | yarn-cluster | spark master address of standalone mode, ex) spark://master_host:7077

spark.submit.deployMode.name: spark.submit.deployMode
spark.submit.deployMode.description: The deploy mode of Spark driver program, either "client" or "cluster", Which means to launch driver program locally ("client") or remotely ("cluster") on one of the nodes inside the cluster.

spark.driver.cores.name: spark.driver.cores
spark.driver.cores.description: Number of cores to use for the driver process, only in cluster mode.

spark.driver.memory.name: spark.driver.memory
spark.driver.memory.description: Amount of memory to use for the driver process, i.e. where SparkContext is initialized, in the same format as JVM memory strings with a size unit suffix ("k", "m", "g" or "t") (e.g. 512m, 2g).

spark.executor.cores.name: spark.executor.cores
spark.executor.cores.description: The number of cores to use on each executor

spark.executor.memory.name: spark.executor.memory
spark.executor.memory.description: Executor memory per worker instance. ex) 512m, 32g

spark.executor.instances.name: spark.executor.instances
spark.executor.instances.description: The number of executors for static allocation.

spark.files.name: spark.files
spark.files.description: Comma-separated list of files to be placed in the working directory of each executor. Globs are allowed.

spark.jars.name: spark.jars
spark.jars.description: Comma-separated list of jars to include on the driver and executor classpaths. Globs are allowed.

spark.jars.packages.name: spark.jars.packages
spark.jars.packages.description: Comma-separated list of Maven coordinates of jars to include on the driver and executor classpaths. The coordinates should be groupId:artifactId:version. If spark.jars.ivySettings is given artifacts will be resolved according to the configuration in the file, otherwise artifacts will be searched for in the local maven repo, then maven central and finally any additional remote repositories given by the command-line option --repositories.

zeppelin.spark.useHiveContext.name: zeppelin.spark.useHiveContext
zeppelin.spark.useHiveContext.description: Use HiveContext instead of SQLContext if it is true. Enable hive for SparkSession.

zeppelin.spark.maxResult.name: zeppelin.spark.maxResult
zeppelin.spark.maxResult.description: Max number of result to display.

zeppelin.spark.enableSupportedVersionChe.name: zeppelin.spark.enableSupportedVersionCheck
zeppelin.spark.enableSupportedVersionChe.description: Whether checking supported spark version. Developer only setting, not for production use

zeppelin.spark.uiWebUrl.name: zeppelin.spark.uiWebUrl
zeppelin.spark.uiWebUrl.description: Override Spark UI default URL. In Kubernetes mode, value can be Jinja template string with 3 template variables 'PORT', 'SERVICE_NAME' and 'SERVICE_DOMAIN'. (ex: http://{{PORT}}-{{SERVICE_NAME}}.{{SERVICE_DOMAIN}})

zeppelin.spark.ui.hidden.name: zeppelin.spark.ui.hidden
zeppelin.spark.ui.hidden.description: Whether hide spark ui in zeppelin ui

spark.webui.yarn.useProxy.name: spark.webui.yarn.useProxy
spark.webui.yarn.useProxy.description: whether use yarn proxy url as spark weburl, e.g. http://localhost:8088/proxy/application_1583396598068_0004

zeppelin.spark.scala.color.name: zeppelin.spark.scala.color
zeppelin.spark.scala.color.description: Whether enable color output of spark scala interpreter

zeppelin.spark.deprecatedMsg.show.name: zeppelin.spark.deprecatedMsg.show
zeppelin.spark.deprecatedMsg.show.description: Whether show the spark deprecated message, spark 2.2 and before are deprecated. Zeppelin will display warning message by default

zeppelin.spark.concurrentSQL.name: zeppelin.spark.concurrentSQL
zeppelin.spark.concurrentSQL.description: Execute multiple SQL concurrently if set true.

zeppelin.spark.concurrentSQL.max.name: zeppelin.spark.concurrentSQL.max
zeppelin.spark.concurrentSQL.max.description: Max number of SQL concurrently executed

zeppelin.spark.sql.stacktrace.name: zeppelin.spark.sql.stacktrace
zeppelin.spark.sql.stacktrace.description: Show full exception stacktrace for SQL queries if set to true.

zeppelin.spark.sql.interpolation.name: zeppelin.spark.sql.interpolation
zeppelin.spark.sql.interpolation.description: Enable ZeppelinContext variable interpolation into spark sql

PYSPARK_PYTHON.name: PYSPARK_PYTHON
PYSPARK_PYTHON.description: Python binary executable to use for PySpark in both driver and workers (default is python2.7 if available, otherwise python). Property `spark.pyspark.python` take precedence if it is set

PYSPARK_DRIVER_PYTHON.name: PYSPARK_DRIVER_PYTHON
PYSPARK_DRIVER_PYTHON.description: Python binary executable to use for PySpark in driver only (default is `PYSPARK_PYTHON`). Property `spark.pyspark.driver.python` take precedence if it is set

zeppelin.pyspark.useIPython.name: zeppelin.pyspark.useIPython
zeppelin.pyspark.useIPython.description: Whether use IPython when it is available

zeppelin.R.render.options.name: zeppelin.R.render.options
zeppelin.R.render.options.value: out.format = 'html', comment = NA, echo = FALSE, results = 'asis', message = F, warning = F, fig.retina = 2

zeppelin.kotlin.shortenTypes.name: zeppelin.kotlin.shortenTypes
zeppelin.kotlin.shortenTypes.description: Show short types instead of full, e.g. List<String> or kotlin.collections.List<kotlin.String>

shell.command.timeout.millisecs.name: shell.command.timeout.millisecs
shell.command.timeout.millisecs.description: Shell command time out in millisecs. Default = 60000

shell.working.directory.user.home.name: shell.working.directory.user.home
shell.working.directory.user.home.description: If this set to true, the shell's working directory will be set to user home

zeppelin.shell.auth.type.name: zeppelin.shell.auth.type
zeppelin.shell.auth.type.description: If auth type is needed, Example: KERBEROS

zeppelin.shell.interpolation.name: zeppelin.shell.interpolation
zeppelin.shell.interpolation.description: Enable ZeppelinContext variable interpolation into paragraph text

zeppelin.terminal.ip.mapping.name: zeppelin.terminal.ip.mapping
zeppelin.terminal.ip.mapping.description: Internal and external IP mapping of zeppelin server

markdown.parser.type.name: markdown.parser.type
markdown.parser.type.description: Markdown Parser Type. Available values: pegdown, markdown4j, flexmark. Default = flexmark

sparql.engine.name: sparql.engine
sparql.engine.description: The sparql engine to use for the queries. Default: jena

sparql.endpoint.name: sparql.endpoint
sparql.endpoint.description: Complete URL of the endpoint. Default: http://dbpedia.org/sparql

sparql.replaceURIs.name: sparql.replaceURIs
sparql.replaceURIs.description: Replace the URIs in the result with the prefixes. Default: true

sparql.removeDatatypes.name: sparql.removeDatatypes
sparql.removeDatatypes.description: Remove the datatypes from Literals so Zeppelin can use the values. Default: true

mongo.shell.command.table.limit.name: mongo.shell.command.table.limit
mongo.shell.command.table.limit.description: Limit of documents displayed in a table

mongo.server.host.name: mongo.server.host
mongo.server.host.description: MongoDB server host to connect to

mongo.server.port.name: mongo.server.port
mongo.server.port.description: MongoDB server port to connect to
